result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eva M. Lofton

records.addlTxt: The 10/20/2022 Hearing has been rescheduled to 11/11/2022 at 10:00 am, at the request of Attorney Koesser.  For 22CM21 case only.
The 9/30/2022 Hearing has been rescheduled to 10/20/2022 at 9:45 am, at the request of Attorney Kmiec's office for 19TR11738 & 19TR11739.
The 7/28/2022 hearing has been rescheduled to 9/30/2022 at 9:30 am due to a week long jury trial.

09:09 AM Defendant, Eva M. Lofton, appeared with Attorney Hans Peter Koesser.  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CM21/19TR11737/19TR11738. Attorney Koesser is requesting an adjournment as the DE has 2 pending matters in Branch 1 and would like discuss a global resolution with the State. 19TR1137 and 19TR1138 to trail. Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:05 AM Defendant, Eva M. Lofton, appeared with Attorney Hans Peter Koesser.

MINUTES:

The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.
